thread.title: The Maldives comes to London's Southbank
thread.title_full: The Maldives comes to London's Southbank

author: mich@girlracer.me.uk (Michelle Chenery)
title: The Maldives comes to London's Southbank
text:
The Maldives comes to London's Southbank The Maldives comes to London's Southbank Details Category: Venues & Events   11:00 The Maldives Marketing and Public Relations Corporation (MMPRC) together with the High Commission of UK conducted cultural performances at the South Bank on 16th August. A troupe of male and female performers entertained visitors on the South Bank throughout the day with a number of performances accompanied by the steady beat of the specialist drummers. 
Information about Visit Maldives Year (VMY) 2016 was provided to the visitors along with promotional materials. The main purpose of this event is to boost the number of arrivals from UK and to commence the VMY 2016 celebrations in UK. Mr. Mohamed Adam, Deputy Managing Director of MMPRC says, “We wanted to bring a taste of our Maldivian culture to the UK and felt London’s Southbank provided the perfect platform to showcase our cultural heritage at this exciting time and to encourage UK travellers to come and experience it for themselves in the Maldives.” UK is the third largest market to Maldives by the end of May 2015 with 7.7% of the market share. From January to May 2015, 25,444 tourist arrivals were recorded from UK. Although the arrivals from the market declined in the recent months, the arrivals are forecasted to increase in the upcoming months. Related articles
